div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2296 Bougie (anc. Saldae), 200 km. E of Algiers, Algeria, 1929 Burial: c. 200 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 2500+ AE. (18.45 kg.) Carthage: Carthage mint (as SNGCop. 302 [11]; 307 [78]; 316 [6]; 317 [10]; 320 [7]; 321 [1]; 326 [12]; 353 [1]; 397 [1]-some overstruck on Hieron II of Syracuse) Sicilian mint (as SNGCop. 381) Disposition: Algiers Jenkins-Lewis, Carthage, p. 49 Note by E. S. G. Robinson (about 130 specimens examined)
